item.title: 十天前失去家园的弗罗里达人被要求再次撤离
item.description: 数百万弗罗里达人已被命令从墨西哥湾沿岸撤离，因为正在逼近的五级飓风有可能百年来首次直接袭击人口稠密的坦帕湾地区。【原文：Millions of Floridians have been ordered to evacuate from the Gulf Coast as an approaching Category 5 hurricane threatens the first direct strike on the densely populated Tampa Bay area in 100 years.】

item.title: 接二连三的飓风将使联邦紧急事务管理局（FEMA）捉襟见肘，资金捉襟见肘
item.description:
前联邦紧急事务管理局（FEMA）局长表示，飓风米尔顿在 "海伦 "肆虐佛罗里达州仅数天后就逼近佛罗里达州，而且可能造成更大的损失。【原文：

Hurricane Milton is bearing down on Florida only days after Helene tore through and could cost even more, says a former FEMA head.

】

item.description: 约瑟夫-桑伯格（Joseph Sumberg）是高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Joseph Sumberg, a former managing director at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. who now works for billionaire climate investor Tom Steyer, says commercial real estate deals will increasingly need to factor in property insurance, as hurricane seasons get more destructive and coverage less reliable.】

item.title: 飓风米尔顿成为海湾地区致命的 5 级风暴
item.description: 米尔顿已增强为 5 级飓风，向佛罗里达州西海岸袭来，那里的居民已开始向内陆逃离。【原文：Milton strengthened into a Category 5 hurricane as it bears down on Florida’s west coast, where residents have begun to flee inland.】

item.title: Lucid 季度产量下降，低于分析师预期
item.description: Lucid Group Inc. 的电动汽车产量在第三季度出现下滑，尽管交付量超出预期，但仍未达到分析师的预期。【原文：Lucid Group Inc.’s electric vehicle production dropped in the third quarter and missed analysts’ forecasts, even as deliveries exceeded expectations.】

item.title: 米尔顿成为威胁佛罗里达西海岸的大飓风
item.description: 米尔顿 "威力大增，已成为汹涌向佛罗里达州西部海岸线的主要飓风，促使该地区进行人员疏散和风暴潮警报，该地区仍在从 "海伦 "的破坏中恢复。【原文：Milton has exploded in power to become a major hurricane churning toward Florida’s western coastline, prompting evacuations and storm surge watches in a region that’s still recovering from Helene’s devastation.】

item.title: 欧盟碳排放与天然气价格的相关性终于打破了

item.title: 佛罗里达州准备迎接新一轮冲击

item.title: 公用事业公司阻止野火的极端计划：关闭电源
item.description:

After facing billions of dollars in damages, companies from California to Texas are enacting blackouts when the weather conditions create high fire risk.

】

item.title: Stellantis 经销商反驳汽车制造商关于欧盟排放目标的观点
item.description: Stellantis NV 经销商敦促欧盟推迟在明年实施更严格的二氧化碳排放规定，这一立场与该汽车制造商对该规定的支持背道而驰。【原文：Stellantis NV dealers urged the European Union to delay the introduction of stricter CO2 emissions rules next year, a stance that runs counter to the carmaker’s support for the mandates.】

item.title: 随着 3i 退出，Valorem 将从 AIP、法国农业信贷银行 Fort Renewables 获得 2 亿欧元资金
item.description: 法国风力发电场开发商 Valorem SAS 准备从 AIP Management P/S 和法国农业信贷银行（Credit Agricole SA）融资 2 亿欧元（2.19 亿美元），为未来的项目提供资金。【原文：French wind-farm developer Valorem SAS is poised to raise €200 million ($219 million) to fund future projects from AIP Management P/S and Credit Agricole SA.】

item.title: 飓风米尔顿的危险路径由沸腾的墨西哥湾海水驱动
item.description: 飓风 "米尔顿 "的爆发力来自墨西哥湾的高温水域，不到两周前的致命飓风 "海伦 "也是在这一水域加剧的。【原文：Hurricane Milton’s explosion in strength comes from high-temperature Gulf of Mexico waters that also intensified the deadly Helene less than two weeks ago, contributing to the new storm’s odd west-to-east track that threatens Tampa, Florida.】

item.title: 飓风海伦过后，佛罗里达州面临致命热带威胁
item.description: 热带风暴 "米尔顿 "有可能演变成一场大飓风，袭击包括坦帕在内的佛罗里达州墨西哥湾沿岸地区，可能造成数十亿美元的损失，给这个不到两周前还在遭受 "海伦 "袭击的州和地区带来更多苦难。【原文：Tropical Storm Milton is threatening to grow into a major hurricane aimed at Florida’s Gulf Coast including Tampa, potentially causing billions of dollars in damage and heaping more misery on a state and region still reeling from Helene less than two weeks ago.】

item.title: 大坝即将泄洪，泰国政府发布洪水警报
item.description: 泰国政府已向包括曼谷在内的 11 个中部省份发出洪水预警，因为位于湄南河沿岸的一座大型水坝准备泄洪。【原文：Thailand’s government has issued a flood warning to 11 central provinces, including Bangkok, as a major dam located along the Chao Phraya River prepares to release water.】

item.title: 海伦飓风肆虐，佛罗里达面临新的飓风威胁
item.description: 在飓风海伦肆虐美国东南部大片地区不到两周之后，佛罗里达州正在为另一场潜在的飓风做好准备。【原文：Florida is bracing for another potential hurricane less than two weeks after Hurricane Helene devastated a wide swath of the US Southeast.】

item.description:
洪水影响着美国的每一个州，但大多数房主都认为洪水不会发生在自己身上。【原文：

item.title: 河水泛滥，泰国旅游城市清迈遭受洪水袭击
item.description: 由于一条主要河流的水位暴涨，再加上一座大坝的蓄水能力超标，泰国北部一个重要旅游城市的部分地区以及周边省份已被洪水淹没。【原文：Areas of a key tourist city in northern Thailand, as well as the surrounding provinces, have been flooded by swelling water levels of a major river in addition to a dam exceeding storage capacity.】

item.title: 欧洲的城市困境：从变暖的未来拯救过去
item.description: 每一位来到维也纳的游客都会被带到米凯勒广场（Michaelerplatz），这是位于奥地利首都中心的一个圆形鹅卵石广场。在中世纪教堂、巴洛克式建筑和现代主义的卢斯豪斯（Looshaus）建筑的映衬下，这里的标志性建筑每年都会吸引数十万人前来参观。【原文：Every tourist in Vienna is at some point directed to Michaelerplatz, a circular cobblestone plaza in the heart of the Austrian capital. Framed by a medieval church, baroque buildings and the modernist Looshaus, the site’s iconic architecture attracts hundreds of thousands of people a year.】

item.title: 布鲁塞尔将推迟柴油限制，以应对绿色议程的反弹
item.description: 布鲁塞尔推迟了在欧盟首都禁止大量柴油车的计划，因为气候措施遭到了更广泛的反弹。【原文：Brussels delayed a plan to ban a wide swath of diesel cars from the capital of the European Union amid a wider backlash against climate measures.】

item.title: 最高法院维持美国环保局甲烷排放规则不变
item.description: 美国最高法院暂时拒绝停止拜登政府对油井、油罐和输油管道排放的会导致地球变暖的甲烷的打击。【原文：The US Supreme Court refused for now to halt a Biden administration crackdown on planet-warming methane emissions from oil wells, tanks and pipelines.】

item.title: 马士基希望船舶监管机构在 2025 年批准全球二氧化碳征税
item.description: 航运业巨头 A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S 预计，该行业的全球监管机构将于明年批准对船舶的温室气体排放收费。【原文：Shipping giant A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S expects the industry’s global regulator next year to approve a charge on vessels’ greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 即将到来的全球水资源保卫战
item.description:
世界上有一半人口面临缺水问题，《汉娜-弗莱与未来》 探讨如何利用技术扭转这一日益严峻的螺旋式上升趋势。【原文：

With half of the world’s population facing water scarcity, The Future with Hannah Fry explores how technology may be used to reverse an increasingly dire spiral.

】

item.title: 欧洲央行警告银行在气候风险管理方面将面临更多罚款
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）警告企业，如果不充分应对未来的风险，将面临更多罚款，从而加大力度让贷款人做好应对气候变化影响的准备。【原文：The European Central Bank has stepped up its efforts to prepare lenders for the fallout from climate change by warning firms they face even more fines if they don’t sufficiently address the risks ahead.】
